title: Letters to Barron’s
text:
Brokerage Commission Fees

To the Editor: First, I believe that the near-universal adoption of zero-percent commissions is driven largely by reality, and brokerages are just formalizing the fact that most retail investors no longer buy individual stocks anyway (“The New Broker Wars,” Cover Story, Oct. 4).

In fact, a friend of mine was told by his Charles Schwab advisor that “we no longer promote clients buying or owning individual stocks” but, rather, exchange-traded funds and mutual funds. This is now a business practice,...
